name: Chicken Quesadilla
description: Mexican classic with crispy tortilla filled with melted cheese, seasoned chicken, and colorful peppers.

instructions.instruction: Marinate chicken slices with cumin, paprika, garlic powder, and salt.
Sauté onion and peppers in 1 tbsp olive oil over medium heat for 4-5 minutes.
Remove vegetables, add 1 tbsp oil to same pan.
Cook marinated chicken, 3-4 minutes per side.
Slice cooked chicken into thin strips.
Spread 1/4 of cheese mixture on half of tortilla.
Top with chicken and sautéed vegetables.
Sprinkle more cheese and fold tortilla in half.
Cook quesadilla in clean pan with little oil, 2-3 minutes per side until crispy and golden.
instructions.tip: Use medium-low heat so cheese melts before tortilla burns.

instructions.instruction: Cut into triangles, serve with sour cream and salsa.

tips: Use leftover chicken for quick preparation.
Choose whole wheat tortillas for healthier option.
Low heat is crucial for proper cheese melting.
storageInfo: Cooked quesadillas keep 2 days refrigerated. Reheat in oven or toaster.
servingSuggestion: Serve with fresh salad and guacamole on the side.
variations: Vegetarian: Use mushrooms and zucchini instead of chicken.
Steak: Use thinly sliced beef instead of chicken.
Breakfast: Add scrambled eggs for morning meal.
